meanings.definition: Move or cause to move rapidly around and around.
meanings.sent1: She whirls around in circles on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The dancer whirls gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The wind whirls the leaves into a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: Time whirls by like a spinning top.
meanings.sent5: The tornado whirls through the town, leaving chaos in its wake.

meanings.definition: A rapid turning or whirling motion.
meanings.sent1: The whirls of the washing machine can be mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The figure skater executed perfect whirls on the ice.
meanings.sent3: The whirls of the amusement park ride made everyone dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The whirls of the storm clouds signaled an approaching tornado.
meanings.sent5: The whirls of the whirlpool pulled everything towards its center.
